alert.note: Alert for Northern Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 7:26PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Big Horn County through 800 PM MDT... At 725 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Hardin, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, nickel size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Big Horn County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
